statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Georgetown 79, Howard 56
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Brandon Bowman had 18 points, seven rebounds and three blocks Thursday to lead Georgetown to a 79-56 victory over crosstown rival Howard. Freshman center Roy Hibbert added 12 points and three blocks for the Hoyas (8-3), who shot 65 percent in the second half and 60 percent for the game. Will Gant scored 18 points, and Cliffone Ault had 11 to lead the Bison (4-6), who shot just 31 percent and have lost all six meetings against Georgetown by an average of 29 points. Georgetown has never lost to a team from the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference, although Hoyas were taken to overtime by Norfolk State on Tuesday. Both teams sputtered most of the first half, with Howard starting 2-for-19 from the field and Georgetown going 5-for-13. The score was just 14-6 after 11 minutes, and Hoyas freshman forward Jeff Green was on the bench quickly with three fouls. Georgetown began to take control with back-to-back alley-oop dunks by Bowman late in the half. The Hoyas closed the half with a 15-5 run to lead 33-16 at the break. Howard made just 5 of 33 shots in the first half, including 1 of 10 3-pointers. Ault was for 1-for-8, and the Bison had eight shots blocked. Georgetown had only one basket in the half that wasn't either a dunk, layup or 3-pointer. The Bison didn't get closer than 16 points in the second half.
